snippet: The Afghan government was faced with not just retaking Kunduz, the northern city that fell to the Taliban on Monday, but also preventing a nearby city from falling as well.
abstract: Afghans lose confidence in country's military after smaller Taliban force seizes Kunduz; reports of Taliban stronghold in neighboring Baghlan Province complicates efforts to save Kunduz, and causes residents to flee, fearing Baghlan's capital city of Pul-i-Khumri will fall next.

byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and JAWAD SUKHANYAR

lead_paragraph: The Afghan government was faced with not just retaking Kunduz, the northern city that fell to the Taliban on Monday, but also preventing a nearby city from falling as well.

headline.main: Shaken by Taliban Victory in Kunduz, Afghans Flee Another Provincial Capital
headline.print_headline: Shaken by Fall of Kunduz, Afghans Now Fear for Neighboring City

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
